items.title: De Minaur powers through with straight-sets win over Tiafoe
items.description: Alex de Minaur defeats American Frances Tiafoe in straight sets on Rod Laver Arena after Yulia Putintseva mocks Turkish fans after knocking out qualifier Zeynep Sönmez.

items.title: Lawyers request AFP probe into Israeli president as Australian visit looms
items.description: The Australian Centre for International Justice has formally requested a police investigation into Israel's president for alleged incitement to genocide. He is expected to visit to Australia next month.

items.title: Gunman wanted over triple shooting could be difficult to find, police say
items.description: Police have warned residents in villages neighbouring Lake Cargelligo to remain vigilant after three people were shot dead in a domestic violence attack on Thursday.

items.title: These maps show why the US is obsessed with Greenland and its Arctic neighbours
items.description: After a week of escalating rhetoric over Greenland, Donald Trump says he has now secured "total access" to the Arctic island. This is why that region is so important.

items.title: Dingoes 'not likely' to have caused Canadian teen's death, autopsy reveals
items.description: A preliminary report from the Coroners Court of Queensland finds dingo bites are not likely to have caused the death of Piper James on K'gari.

items.title: Track temperatures live as heatwave sweeps continent
items.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

items.title: Defiant Sussan Ley downplays Nationals' exit, vows to remain leader
items.description: The Liberal leader did not speak about the Nationals' decision to terminate the Coalition on yesterday's National Day of Mourning, but on Friday insisted her focus was on the government.

items.title: 'It's a quiet town': Neighbours in shock after triple fatal shooting
items.description: Residents of a remote NSW town of just 1,500 residents have expressed shock at a deadly shooting spree where three people were shot dead.

items.title: How landslides happen, the warning signs and where they're most common
items.description: Two people have died after a landslide hit their home in New Zealand and authorities are searching for several others feared dead in another slip nearby. Here's how landslides occur, the warning signs and where they are most common.

items.title: New passport rules designed to improve national security, UK government says
items.description: The requirement for dual British citizens to have a valid UK passport while entering the country would help prevent the arrival of people who present a threat, Australia's British High Commission says.

items.title: West Coast Eagles' Tyler Brockman charged over Geraldton street fight
items.description: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman is charged with causing grievous bodily harm following an incident in Geraldton in late December.

items.title: Viral video of bull shark in Brisbane River sparks AI debate
items.description: A video posted to social media of a bull shark washed up in the Brisbane River went viral and prompted speculation that it was AI-generated, but experts say it appears to be legitimate.

items.title: Paris Hilton brings sex tape story to Washington for AI porn fight
items.description: The party girl turned anti-abuse advocate throws her glamorous celebrity heft behind a push to tackle deepfake pornography.

items.title: Darwin man to serve three years behind bars over father's death
items.description: Jake Fenner, 32, has been handed a partially suspended sentence for causing the death of his father at their Moil home in 2023.

items.title: Small steps to make your home a habitat for native wildlife and birds
items.description: There are simple things we can all do to encourage more native wildlife to our gardens, backyards, balconies and shared spaces.

items.title: Neo-Nazi leader's words too extreme for many in March for Australia crowd
items.description: With the organisers of March for Australia rallies saying they "are in no way concerned by the presence" of members of the National Socialist Network, the ABC can confirm a Tasmanian man whose words were too extreme for many in the Hobart crowd is believed to be a leader within the state's Neo-Nazi movement.

items.title: Venezuela once built a retail mecca. Then it became a notorious 'torture prison'
items.description: Nestled among shanty homes, mountains and forestry, a giant building once touted to become Venezuela's world-leading retail mecca later turned into a centre for alleged human rights abuses.

items.title: Aussies soar, Wicked gone for good and other Oscar nomination surprises and snubs
items.description: Hybrid horror Sinners came up as the big winner in the 98th Academy Award nominations, with Aussie actors also eyeing up gold, and Wicked: For Good wiped off the map.

items.title: Extended police stop-and-search declaration unlawful, court finds
items.description: The Federal Court has found a Victoria Police move to give officers greater powers in Melbourne's CBD for six months was invalid and unlawful.

items.title: One Nation's rise in popularity changes the context of the Coalition's divorce
items.description: It is impossible to view this week’s events without the broader context of the relationship between the Liberals and the Nationals, how the electoral map is changing and what that means for right-wing politics in Australia.

items.title: To Lam wins second term to rule Vietnam through 2030
items.description: Vietnam's leader To Lam has been re-appointed as head of the ruling Communist Party for the next five years, and pledges to turbocharge growth in the export-reliant nation.

items.title: Fatigue a concern as fires threaten towns south of Perth
items.description: DFES says there have been no confirmed property losses as the battle to contain fires near Boddington and Wandering continues.

items.title: Meet the 15yo Melbourne schoolgirl who has taken the Freeski world by storm
items.description: When 15-year-old Indra Brown reached the podium in her first World Cup event, she needed help from global superstar Eileen Gu to pop the cork on her champagne. She's had plenty more practice since, as she heads into the Milan Cortina 2026 Winter Olympic Games.

items.title: US officials reveal multi-billion-dollar Gaza rebuild plans
items.description: US officials have presented their vision for a "New Gaza" that would turn the shattered Palestinian territory into a glitzy resort of skyscrapers by the sea.

items.title: Fears for Saturday's heat as Welsford claims sensational seventh TDU stage win
items.description: Sam Welsford claimed a brilliant Tour Down Under stage victory, the seventh of his career, as experts fear for riders ahead of 40-degree Celsius temperatures predicted for Saturday's fourth stage.
